title: Historical Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio Trends of Cirrus Logic Inc Stock

content.text: The price-to-book (P/B) ratio is calculated by dividing the market price per share of a company by its book value per share. The book value represents the net asset value of the company, calculated by subtracting liabilities from assets.

content.section: Historical P/B Ratio Trends of Cirrus Logic Inc
content.text: Here are the historical P/B ratio trends of Cirrus Logic Inc stock:

Analyzing the historical P/B ratio trends of Cirrus Logic Inc stock can help investors assess the valuation of the company. A higher P/B ratio may indicate that the market has higher expectations for the company's future performance and growth potential. A lower P/B ratio may suggest that the stock is undervalued or that there are concerns about the company's financial health.

news.headline: Deirdre Hanford’s Appointment as CEO of the National Center for the Advancement of Semiconductor Technology

(NASDAQ: CRUS) congratulates Deirdre Hanford, a member of Cirrus Logic’s Board of Directors since 2018, on her appointment as CEO of Natcast, the expected operator of the CHIPS for America National Semiconductor Technology Center, once established.
